thread.title: A remodeled rivalry for UA Hockey
thread.title_full: A remodeled rivalry for UA Hockey

author: David Kelly
title: A remodeled rivalry for UA Hockey
text:
A remodeled rivalry for UA Hockey Posted: TUCSON, AZ (Tucson News Now) - 
UA’s rivalry against Arizona State in hockey is not over. It’s just changing. 
The Sun Devils this season are playing their first year as a sanctioned NCAA Division I level squad. 
ASU opened their first season of DI Hockey with an 8-1 pounding of their rivals Saturday night in front of over 6,000 fans at the Gila River Arena, home of the NHL’s Arizona Coyotes. 
It was the 48th time in the last 49 games the Sun Devils have beaten the Wildcats on the ice. 
Last Saturday’s meeting will be one of two this season UA will play against the NCAA version of the Sun Devils, but despite the move the rivalry is not ending. 
ASU will continue to field two club level teams at the American Collegiate Hockey Association’s Division II level. 
Arizona currently plays ACHA Division I, the level the Sun Devils left when granted NCAA status. 
The Wildcats will play five matches against the Sun Devils Division II Elite squad, which is the higher of ASU’s two club teams. 
UA will host ASU Elite for three games in Tucson and then travel to Tempe for two matches. 
The Sun Devils NCAA team will play in Tucson on Friday, February 19. 
2015 schedule vs. Arizona State: 
Fri. December 4 vs. ASU (Club) TCCSat. December 5 vs. ASU (Club) TCCFri. January 29 at ASU (Club) Oceanside ArenaSat. January 30 at ASU (Club) Oceanside ArenaFri. February 19 vs. ASU (NCAA) TCCSat. February 20 vs. ASU (Club) TCC
